Fondness for puns.
Go on.
Terrible speller.
Oh yeah?
Rut nevertheless had uncovered important information about...
ANGEL and DANNY neglect their speed gun duty.  95.
George Merchant.
Self made millionaire.
Ch-ching.
Fancied himself as a property developer.
Uh-huh.
Had big plans for Sandford.
Pissed on the [U+FB02]oor in the Crown.
But more importantly, was a good friend and client of...
ANGEL and DANNY walk the beat again.
Martin Blower.
Affirmatron.
Respected solicitor and leading light of the local drama society.
Bad actor.
Undoubtedly.
Bad driver.  96.
Not necessarily.
Cheated on his missus.
Most certainly and we both know who with?
ANGEL and DANNY drive back to the sation.
Eve Draper.
Blower’s leading lady.
(Whistles)
Distinctive laugh.
Oh yes.
Liked older men.
Fingered.
But crucially, where did she work?
Council.
Specifically?
The department of planning and development.
Where George Merchant had secured permission to build his dubious mansion on Norris Avenue.  97.
So...
Back in the office, the energy [U+FBO2]ags. DANNY has his head on ANGEL the table, ANGEL [U+FB02]icks endlessly thr his notes.
Tim Messenger was onto something about George Merchant who was into something with Martin Blower who was up to something with Eve Draper.
And Simon Skinner has something to do with it all.
But he runs the local supermarket.
So?
I don’t know, I mean, maybe it was all accidents. People have accidents everyday. Gary Butcher drowned in his own septic tank the other week. ANGEL puts his head on the table too. FRANK swings by.
What are you two up to?
Nothing.
Well, look sharp. There’s been reports of a fire in the station.

What?! DORIS produces a cake with a single candle stuck in it. T other officers gather round, singing ‘Happy Birthday’. AN then notices cards and banners that have clearly been the the whole day. All reading ‘Happy Birthday Danny’.  98. ANGEL (cont’d) You should have said something.
We were working weren’t we? ANGEL is ashamed of himself. He slinks away to the door. DANNY (cont’d) Where you going?
Personal errand.
The squad car races along a street, lights [U+FBO2]ashing
ANGEL pulls up outside ’mourns as LESLIE’ and puts his notebook emphatically on the dashboard. ANGEL arrives at the door as LESLIE TILLER is shutting up
Oh Miss Tiller, I was wondering, have you got any Peace Lilies?
Of course. I was just about to pop off actually.
LESLIE TILLER cuts wrapping paper with large garden shear
I can never find my scissors. Is this for someone special?
Yes. Yes it is. ANGEL spies packing crates and boxes on the [U+FBO2]oor. ANGEL (cont’d) Are you going somewhere Miss Tiller?  99.
No. Well, yes. I’m moving away. It’s all a bit out of the blue. I was planning to disappear quietly actually. I do so hate goodbyes.
And why the move, if you don’t mind me asking?
Well, just between you and I... LESLIE TILLER seems a little edgy. ANGEL is intrigued.
Yes?
You know that fella who blew up?
George Merchant.

That’s him, well George Merchant - god rest him - he wanted to buy this land, so he sends round his legal fella Martin Blower - god rest him - I thought I might take them up on it, because I’ve been thinking about moving for some time, I haven’t really got that much family round here, save for Cousin Sissy. And while the "Village Of The Year’ stuff is great and everything, I don’t really see anything from it, so I thought I might take them up on the offer and move to Buford Abbey. Would you like a card with this?
No, it’s okay. You were saying about the offer?

Well, it turns out that Martin Blower - god rest him - knew where the new bypass road is going because he was knocking off Eve Draper from the council - god rest her - then that reporter - god rest (MORE)

LESLIE TILLER (cont'd) him - finds out about the route and tells me the land’s very valuable, ten times what George Merchant and Martin Blower - god rest them - offered me. So with them having passed on and me still owning the land, I decided to sell it on myself to some folks from the city that Martin, George and Eve - god rest the lot of them - had been talking to, apparently they want to build a big shopping centre or something, of course Cousin Sissy won’t be too happy about that, but as far as I’m concerned - ANGEL pats his pockets for his note book.
Would you excuse me for one second?
Of course.

ANGEL leaves the [U+FBO2]orist. He runs back to the car t get his pocketbook. In the background we can see LESLIE TILLER wrapping the [U+FBO2]owers - but we can also see - The CLOAKED FIGURE slips in from the back room of the sho grabs the shears and plunges them into LESLIE TILLER’s throat. Blood spurts all over the counter and front windo ANGEL turns back to see...TILLER dead. Shears in her neck The blood. A SHADOW disappearing into the stock room...
Stop. In the name of the law! ANGEL runs towards the [U+FB02]Jorist, throwing his truno at the window. It shatters a second before he jumps throu

ANGEL runs into the stock room, to see the CLOAKED FIGURE running through the aisles of the stock room. He gives chase. SMASH. The CLOAKED FIGURE jumps through a greenhouse wind catching their leg on the frame.  101. ANGEL is almost on top of him and jumps through the newly smashed window. Landing, he looks up to see the FIGURE no good 50 metres ahead, running towards a greenhouse and knocking garden furniture in its wake. ANGEL sprints off again, bursting into the greenhouse and gaining on the CLOAKED EIGUEE. Both knock plants asunder. The CLOAKED EIGURE slices through a mesh door with a knif and disappears over a hedge at the nursery perimeter. ANGEL reaches the final hedge to find the CLOAKED FIGURE, now 100 metres away, sprinting across a cricket pitch. A breathless ANGEL stands at the hedge, confused and amaz
Back at the [U+FBO2]orist. ANGEL and FISHER stare at LESL TILLER who lies dead, shears protruding from her neck.
Hang about, hang about. You’re saying this wasn’t an accident?
The assembled officers look at ANGEL as if he is insane.
What just like Tim Messenger?
Yes!
And George Merchant?
Yes!
And Eve Draper? ANGEL scrawls on a piece of paper the word ‘YES’.  102.
Yes!
And Martin Blower?
No, actually.
Really?
Really?
DANNY pops a coin in the swearbox. ANGEL (cont’d) Thank you Danny.
Oh Murder. Murder. Murder. Change the fucking record. CARTWRIGHT pops a coin in the swearbox for WAINWRIGHT. WAINWRIGHT (cont’d) Thank you Andy.
Yes come on Sergeant, you’ve got to accept that it was another terrible accident.
Are you suggesting Leslie Tiller somehow tripped and fell on her own shears?
Ben Fletcher fell on his pitchfork the other week.
People have accidents everyday. What makes you think it was murder?
Because I was there.  103.
Yeah, that’s a point. Why were you there?
I was buying a Japanese Peace Lily for Constable Butterman’s birthday.
What absolute horseshit.
Look, I chased a suspect from the scene. Innocent people don’t run.
It might have been our old friend the cactus thief again.
Yeah, he was a prickly customer. Everyone laughs. ANGEL crumples against the nonsense.
Am I going completely mad?
Maybe you are?
Ieah, maybe you killed her, seeing as you’re such a big fan of murder.
What !?
Sergeant Angel?
YES....sir? FRANK ushers ANGEL into his office and shuts the blinds.
Nicholas, Nicholas, Nicholas, what am I going to do with you?
Chief, you’ve got to understand-  104.
No, you have to understand, the boys here aren’t used to the concepts you’re bandying about. (off Angel’s look) The ‘’M’ word, Nicholas. There hasn’t been a recorded murder in Sandford for 20 years.
But I’m sure sir. And what’s more, I know who did it.
I hope you’re not going to say who I think you’re going say. INT. SKINNER’S OFFICE - NIGHT
Could I see the manager please? ANGEL and co. burst into SKINNER’s office to find the CHECKOUT GIRL chewing gum. She intones into the tannoy.

Mr. Skinner to the manager’s office please. Managers office. Mr. Skinner. INT. SKINNER’S GEFICE - NIGHT The cops are all crammed into the office. ANGEL stands purposefully. Various employees look through the office window.
Sergeant Angel. Officers. To what do I owe this pleasure?
I’m arresting you on suspicion of the murder of Leslie Tiller.
Leslie Tiller is dead? How?
She tripped and fell on her own shears. ANGEL throws a pen at FISHER’s head. He yelps.  105.
I’m also arresting you on suspicion of the murders of Tim Messenger on May ist, George Merchant on April 29th and Eve Draper and Martin Blower on April 28th.
Why on earth would I want to do that Sergeant?

I’m glad you asked. The following is illustrated with oodles of FLASHCUTS. It looks pretty damn cool, for a British film. ANGEL (cont’d) My suspicions were [U+FBO2]rst aroused when you appeared at the scene of the Blower/Draper deaths, on the outskirts of Sandford, despite living and working in the centre of the village. I couldn’t help recall your comments at the theatre the previous evening, when you not only indicated your awareness of the couple’s affair but also inferred that Ms. Draper’s connections at the council might make her privy to important information. You yourself spoke of "bashing her head in". Perhaps hoping you might discover the route for the proposed Sandford Bypass. You were already suspicious that Blower’s client George Merchant was buying up an area of land on the edge of the village, after a story Tim Messenger ran in the Citizen. You put two and two together after noting Merchant’s use of your car park to visit Blower who you knew all too well had an inside connection at the council. The land Merchant was buying up had no particular value as it was but if it were to be made accessible by a new road, it would become an ideal location for perhaps, a retail park. Consumed with concern for your business and potential disloyalty from fickle customers (MORE)

ANGEL (cont’d) whom you yourself stated the desire to behead, you killed the potential competition in cold blood, staging the murders as accidents. You used a vehicle removal truck to stage the Blower/Draper crash and incinerated an old man in his house, covering your tracks with the judicial application of bacon and beans. However, there was a loose end. Tim Messenger foolishly confronted you at the village fete, after his own investigations lead him to the same conclusions. So you silenced him, before he could voice his concerns to me but not before he had told Leslie Tiller about the true value of her land. Upon discovering that she was about to sell up to the developers, you brutally murdered her with her own shears and made your escape utilising your impressive prize winning skills as a fun runner. ANGEL finishes his summation, by resting his hand on a ’f run’ trophy. The room is astonished. SKINNER claps slowly
Very entertaining, Sergeant Angel. But I rather think you’ve been watching too many films.
He hasn’t.
Why would I kill Leslie? You clearly aren’t aware we’re related.
Oh but I am, ’Cousin Sissy’. ANGEL slaps down a photocopied sheet of a family tree article from the ’Sandford Citizen’. Highlighted are Skin and Tiller’s connected names. SKINNER scoffs.
I’m afraid my nickname of Sissy is only a revelation to yourself. My teenage years studying ballet are well known.
Yeah Sissy Skinner.
What a gaylord!

Thank you Andrews. Despite my comment about beheading customers, what we here on Planet Sandford like to refer to as ’a joke’ I would personally relish the competition of another store. Anything to energise my workforce. SKINNEE gesticulates to his gormless minions

You would relish the competition. Especially if it was yourself. As Miss Tiller’s only cousin, you’re set to inherit her land, on which you plan to build a Summeraisles Express. The perfect one stop shop for bypass traffic. ANGEL points to the sketch of a new store on
These sketches are just pipe dreams. Anyway, what makes you think I could dislodge part of the church roof? Or for that matter stage a car crash?

It’s a well known fact that the church roof is severely in need of repair. As for the car, isn’t it true that two of your employees also operate the council’s vehicle removal truck? 107. outside. the wall. ANGEL points to the GRUFF LOOKING BUTCHERS. They are the same GRUFF LOOKING MEN from the removal vehicle earlier.
Sergeant, this is the 21st Century, I’1l think you find that many people hold down several jobs, I myself host a life drawing class at the Village Hall. (nods to Checkout Girl) (MORE)
SKINNER (cont’d) Tina here is a table dancer at Flappers.
The thing is Mr. Skinner, you could quite easily have obtained access to the removal vehicle and used it for your own ends.
These accusations are meaningless Sergeant, unless you can back them up with hard evidence.

Well you’ve certainly got me there. We’d need something conclusive. Like perhaps a wound you sustained on a shard of broken glass this very evening. ANGEL awkwardly pulls back SKINNER’s trouser legs. Nothin

Oh Sergeant, this is getting to be embarrassing. Apart from anything else, how can I be in several places at once? I’m sure the store’s security footage can absolve me. Do feel free to spool through. INT. SKINNER’S OFFICE - NIGHT A frustrated ANGEL spools a huge pile of VHS tapes. We se CCTV images of SKINNER stagily strolling the shop [U+FBO2]oor. The other officers drift out of the office, grumbling. Soon only DANNY and FRANK remain. FRANK slaps a hand on ANGEL’s shoulder and leaves. DANNY picks up another tape.
I can handle this Danny You enjoy the rest of your birthday.
Did you really get me that plant?  109.
Yes, but it’s been impounded as evidence.
Maybe I can still water it. DANNY leaves as SKINNER apprcaches with LURCH.
Sergeant, I wanted you to know that if I do indeed now own the land belonging to Leslie, I intend to turn it into a memorial garden, in her honour.
(blows raspberry) Jog on.
Michael, will you escort the Sergeant off the premises when he’s quite finished?
Yarp.
ANGEL eats alone, a broken man. JOYCE serves him wine.
I can’t believe Leslie’s dead. How did it happen again?
She tripped and fell on her own shears.
ANGEL and DANNY are getting into uniform. Retrieving his cap, ANGEL sees the word ’TWAT’ written on the inside.
That wasn’t me.  110.
DANNY and ANGEL sit in their usual spot, as the high stre is being decorated with bunting. DANNY leeks at ANGEL, wh stares off intc space.
Look Nicholas. Mr. Treacher’s got his big coat on again...Want anything from the shop?
Cornetto.
DANNY buys two ice-creams from a smirking ANNETTE ROPER. ANGEL watches on morosely.
No luck catching them killers then?
It’s just the one killer actually.

DANNY throws some change into the fountain. They get into the squad car, licking their ice creams. ANNETTE’S words echo in ANGEL’s head; ’No luck catching them killers then Licking his ice cream; ANGEL ponders DANNY’s response; ‘I just the one killer actually’. The words resonate. ANGEL stops eating his ice cream, his eyes go wide.
What’s the matter? You got brainfreeze?
No I got brainwave. Get us back to the station. Now! NANNY starts the car, whilst trying to finish as much of ice cream as he can. He clutches his head in pain.
Arrrgh!  111.
The squad car screeches to a halt in the car park.
It’s more than one person.
Come again?
More than one killer.
It was Skinner a minute ago.
Maybe it still is. Maybe he’s not alone. Maybe there are others.
Who exactly?
I don’t know but we were buying Cornettos and it suddenly hit me-
You’re an exceptional officer, Nicholas. Truly exceptional. But I’ve seen this before.
Sir?

Sergeant Popwell. It was exactly the same thing. You’ve come from a city where there’s danger round every corner and it’s driven you round the bend. ANGEL visibly sags. He becomes listless and compliant.
Yes sir.
Listen, I’m due at a function in about half an hour. So do yourself a favour. Sleep on it. If you feel the same way in the morning, I give you my word, we’ll get right on it.  112.
Thank you sir.
ANGEL leaves the station. DANNY follows, confused.
What happened? what’s going on?
Nothing. I was just- I’m gonna go back and crash for a bit.
Oh okay. Need a lift?
No, I could do with the walk. ANGEL walks off, feeling guilty. DANNY looks forlorn.
ANGEL trudges home, the street is festooned with bunting.
ANGEL slopes through the hotel reception. It is empty. A ROMEO AND JULIET poster shows understudies, Greg and Sher smiling as the male and female lead.
ANGEL takes out his key. He notices his door is ajar. The door [U+FB02]ies open...A huge CLOAKED FIGURE lifts A off the ground, throws him inside and slams the door behi

ANGEL hits the wall with a thud. He gets up and throws several punches at his attacker, but stops, clutching his injured hand. The FIGURE picks ANGEL up in a bear hug. AN struggles, pulling the assailant’s hood off to reveal-  113. LURCH. They look at each other for a second. ANGEL brings his [U+FB02]sts down on either side of LURCH’s head. LURC drops ANGEL, holding his ears. ANGEL kicks LURCH in the balls. He barely winces before hurling ANGEL across the r into a painting of the castle. His notebook drops to the [U+FBO2]oor. LUNCH lumbers towards him. ANGEL grabs the CUDDLY MONKEY looks throws it in LURCH’s direction. LUNCH catches it an is momentarily charmed, hypnotised by the monkey’s cute eyes. A whistle from offscreen. LURCH turns to see ANGEL uprigh brandishing his beloved POT PLANT.
Playtime’s over. SMASH. ANGEL hits LURCH across the head, destroying his Peace Lily in the process. LURCH drops. His walkie-talkie clatters to the [U+FB02]oor, crackling to life.
Michael? Michael? Are you there? Michael? Is everything okay? ANGEL speaks into the Walkie-talkie in a thick brogue.
Yarp.
Sergeant Angel has been taken care of?
Yarp.
He’s not going to get back up again?
...Narp?
Good. Proceed to the castle. ANGEL looks to a castle painting on the wall. He pulls ou his phone and dials.  114.
You’ve reached Frank Butterman. Please leave a message after the beep-

Frank. This shit just got real. Skinner just tried to kill me. He’s going somewhere. The castle I think. I’m going there now. I don’t know who to trust. It’s Nicholas by the way. ANGEL turns to see DANNY at the door and jumps a mile. DA looks at LURCH sprawled among the pot plant debris.
Oh my god. What happened to your Peace Lily?
Danny. Stay here. Watch him. Call your Dad. Tell him I was right.
What are you going to do?
I’m going to bust this thing wide open.
Nicholas? Danny picks up ANGEL’s notebook and puts it in his pocket
Thanks partner.
ANGEL runs down the high street past a National Trust sig pointing toward ‘SANDFORD CASTLE’.
ANGEL approaches Sandford Castle ruins, a dilapidated 12t Century Castle. It looks spooky in the dark. ANGEL hears voices coming from inside. We hear chanting-  115.

.bonum commune communitatis... ANGEL peers into the main hall. He sees several BLACK CLOAKED FIGURES standing around a large circular stone tablet. They hold torches under their faces. ANGEL makes out familiar faces under the hoods. We see TO WEAVER, whose words echo in ANGEL’s head; "I can see what the entire village is up to..." ANGEL looks to see 12 walkie talkies on the stone tablet "Got everyone linked up with a walkie so we can keep each other abreast of any misadventure." ANGEL sees SKINNER under one of the hoods. Words echo; "H can I be in several places at once?"... We see ELASHCUTS of the [U+FBO2]orist chase, now with ang that we didn’t see previously; a second CLOAKED FIGURE outside the greenhouse, a third CLOAKED EIGUEE behind the hedge. ANGEL spies some of the other faces - JOYCE COOPER, ANNET

head_text.subj: ROPER, JAMES READER, REV. SHOOTER, DR. HATCHER, AMANDA PA

text: - "We’re basically a group of volunteers who strive to ke the village just so. ANGEL’s thoughts [U+FBO2]ash back to the fountain. We see DANNY throw some change in. The penny drops. We see the plaque; ’This fountain was generously restored with funds raised by F. Butterman, J. Cooper, R. Hatcher, A. Paver.. As the CLOAKED FIGURES stop chanting and sit at the table ANGEL is even more horrified by what he hears next...

Quick announcement before we begin. Janet Barker has decided to call her boys Roger and Martin which is lovely. The christening will be Saturday week and all are welcome. Tom? The CLOAKED FIGURES all swing their torches to WEAVER.

Thanks Joyce. Now you’1l be pleased to know that the tenacious Sergeant Angel has now been taken care of. Thanks must go to Simon Skinner for his efforts in this. Our very own Joyce Cooper will discover the officer tomorrow morning, slumped (MORE)
WEAVER (cont’d) on the wet [U+FBO2]oor of his ensuite bathroom, having slipped in the shower and tragically broken his neck. Dr. Hatcher will take it from there.
Indeed and may I say very well executed Simon. I will of course pronounce the death as accidental. That is after all what I’m here for. All torches to DR. HATCHER. There are mild chuckles.
With Sergeant Angel dispatched, we can concentrate our efforts on eradicating our hoodie infestation, after which nothing will stand in our way.
Oh I beg to differ, Mister Weaver. All the torches spin to the direction of the voice.
Well, well, well, I see we have visitors. ANGEL walks into the torch beams, warrant card aloft.
Sergeant Nicholas Angel. Sandford Police Service.
My, he is tenacious isn’t he?
I’m placing you all under arrest on suspicion of conspiracy to commit murder.
Oh come, come Sergeant Angel.
You should be ashamed of yourselves. This is supposed to be the community that cares!  There’s a 117.
Oh, but we do care Nicholas.
It’s all about the greater good.
The greater good.
What do you mean the greater good?
The greater good.
Sandford, Nicholas. The village.
A happy village is a healthy village.
Perfection breeds contentment and contentment is paramount.
You see, as much as I enjoyed your wild theories Sergeant, the truth is far less complex. Blower’s fate was simply the result of his being an appalling actor. murmur of "appalling".
You murdered him for that?
He murdered Bill Shakespeare.
What!? Oh I see. We see FLASHEACKS of MARTIN ELOWER’s dressing room murder Now, we see new angles with MULTIPLE CLOAKED FIGURES.
The Sandford Players is an important feather in our cap.  118.
We couldn’t let Blower jeopardize that. Not when we had two semimprofessionals waiting in the wings. SKINNER points to an OLDER COUPLE in cloaks who wave back
Let us not forget Greg was an extra in Straw Dogs -
Yes, I know!
Martin was less concerned with the reputation of the village than his sordid affair with Eve Draper. We see FLASHBACKS of EVE’s murder by MULTIPLE KILLERS.
And so Eve deserved to die too?
She did have an annoying laugh. There’s a murmur of ‘annoying’.
And George Merchant?
He had an awful house. There’s a murmur of "awful". We see FLASHBACKS of MERCHANT’S ‘accidental’ explosion. N with MULTIPLE CLOAKED FIGURES engineering it.
We begged him in vain to make his residence more in keeping with the village’s rustic aesthetic.
What was Messenger’s crime?
Tim Messenger’s tenure as editor of the Sandford Citizen has been unbearable.  119.
Our once great paper had become riddled with tabloid journalism and dreadful punnery. Not to mention persistent errors.
He listed her age as 55.
When I’m actually 53.

The church roof was in need of repair and the insurers wouldn’t pay unless it was certified hazardous. Let’s just say we killed two birds with one stone. FLASHBACK of MULTIPLE CLOAKED FIGURES pushing the turret.
What about Leslie Tillar? One of your own? Her her horticultural expertise helped put Sandford on the map.
She was ever so good.
Cousin Leslie was a terrible shame. But it seems she was set on moving away.
We had to stop her before she shared her green fingers with anyone else.
Not least the heathens at Euford Abbey. The NWA simultaneously spit on the ground.
If we can’t have her no-one can.
How can this be for the greater good?!  120.
The greater good.
Shut it. These people died for no reason, no reason whatsoever?
Oh I wouldn’t say that. All torches move to the voice. To ANGEL’s horror, it is FRANK. He wears the era FASHIONED POLICE CAPE.

I was like you once Nicholas. I believed in the immutable word of the law. That is until the night Mrs. Butterman was taken from me. You see, no-one loved Sandford more than her. She was head of the Women’s Institute, chair of the ’[U+FB02]oral committee’, even ran the Neighbourhood Watch before Tom. When they started the ’Village of the Year’ contest, she worked round the clock, it became her life. I’ve never seen such dedication. On the eve of the adjudicator’s arrival, some travellers moved into Callahan Park. Before could say gypsy scum, We were knee deep in dog muck, thieving kids and crusty jugglers. We lost the title and Irene lost her mind. She drove her Datsun Cherry into Sandford Gorge. The inquiry said it was an accident but I knew better. From that moment on I swore that I’d do her proud. And whatever the cost, we’d make Sandford great again.
Sir, this doesn’t make sense.
It makes perfect sense, Sergeant. Frank gathered together a group of the most faithful Sandfordians and showed us how we might rid our streets of the paedophiles and perverts-  121.
-the shoplifters- -the shirtlifters-
-the punks, the drunks- -the thugs, the mugs-
-the hams, the shams- -the drifters, the grifters-
-the dodgers, the bodgers- -the hawkers, the stalkers-
-the gypsies, the tramps- -and thieves-
-the paedophiles, the perverts-
Yeah, you’ve had them.
The adjudicators arrive tomorrow Nicholas. They were supposed to arrive in a couple of months but they brought it forward for some reason. We had to make sure everything was ready.
Are you saying this was all about winning the ’Best Village Award’?
This is the best village Nicholas. You’ve seen the people. They’re happy, contented. Most of them don’t even know about our work. They have very normal lives. There’s a murmur of "very normal".
They’re living in a dream world.  122.
Precisely. No crime. No tension.
Sheer bliss. There’s a murmur of "bliss".
We have created the society you dream about. Isn’t that worth preserving?
Not with murder.
Sgt. Popwell thought much the same as you. I’m disappointed you can’t see the big picture.
Well, I’m happy to disappoint sir. And I’m afraid you’re going to have to come with me. You’re all going to have to come with me.

No Nicholas, I’m afraid it’s you who has to some with us... The NWA reveal an array of weapons from under their cloak axes, scythes, pitchforks, knives etc. Out of the shadows, a bruised and angry LURCH slaps a han on ANGEL’s shoulder. ANGEL is shocked. Another hand lands his other shoulder. he turns to see-

Danny? No! NO! DANNY is silent. He and LURCH wield knives and torches. W lightning speed ANGEL ducks out of their grip, grabs LURC blade, spins behind DANNY and holds it to his throat. He takes DANNY’s torch and shines it at the NWA. ANGEL (cont’d) Now back off or you’1l be explaining to everyone how Danny accidentally tripped and cut his own head off. The NWA continue to close in. FRANK laughs.  123.
Oh come on Nicholas. You haven’t got it in you.

They close in further. Shit. ANGEL throws DANNY to the ground and runs into the woods. The NWA give chase. A hoard of cloaked figures run throug the trees. ANGEL sprints into the darkhess- Suddenly ANGEL trips and falls through a hole in the path

ANGEL crashes to a dusty [U+FB02]oor, winded. He picks up torch and shines it around. He seems to be inside an old GYPSY CARAVAN buried in the ground. His torch picks out a SKELETON IN GYPSY CLOTHING. ANGEL backs up frantically, colliding with an ENTIRE FAMI OF GYPSY SKELETONS, complete with children and dog. ANGEL staggers to the door which bursts open into a cave. His torch picks out many more bodies. The most recent addition, in a PURPLE SHELL SUIT is a dead PETER COCKER. ANGEL jumps back and finds himself staring at a skeleton a police sergeant’s uniform. It has a BIG BUSHY BEARD. ANGEL [U+FB02]ees the cave and sees one other corpse; tha the LIVING STATUE, now frozen in a final expression of terror.
